data.text:
Someday your child may cry

And if you sing this lullabye

Then in your heart

There will always be a part of me

Billy's ballad "Lullabye (Goodnight, My Angel)" is a dreamy and contemplative song about our connection with our children or other loved ones. Billy's little girl Alexa, who was about seven years old at the time, had asked Billy what will happen when he dies. He reassures her that "wherever you may go, no matter where you are, I never will be far away." And later that he will continue to live through her, "someday your child may cry, and if you sing this lullaby, then in your heart, there will always be a part of me."

Billy explained that he told Alexa that "when we die, you go into other people's hearts, you never really go away. You go into the rest of the people that you know, go to the rest of their lives . . . ." Billy has said that he believes that when you die, you go into the hearts of your loved ones. Billy talks about the song and its special meaning between him and Alexa in this snippet from SiriusXM. Click player below:
